item.title: Every Esports World Cup 2026 Game‚ÄîAll Games Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
This year‚Äôs Esports World Cup promises to be the most monumental event in the industry‚Äôs history. There are more games, a bigger prize pool, and a wider array of competitors than ever before. The event is set to run in Riyadh from July 6 to August 23, and twenty-four games will share the grandest stages in the business.

Below, we‚Äôve outlined every Esports World Cup game being hosted at the showcase in 2026.

All EWC 2026 Games

From first-person shooters to racing games, and from battle royale titles to MOBAs, there truly is something for everyone at the Esports World Cup 2026.

Here‚Äôs the full list of games with a place at EWC 2026:

  • Apex Legends
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  • Call of Duty: Warzone
  • Chess
  • Counter-Strike 2
  • Crossfire
  • Dota 2
  • EA Sports FC 26
  • FATAL FURY: City of the Wolves
  • Fortnite
  • Free Fire
  • Honor of Kings
  • League of Legends
  • Mobile Legends: Bang Bang
  • Overwatch 2
  • PUBG: Battlegrounds
  • PUBG Mobile
  • Rocket League
  • Street Fighter 6
  • TEKKEN 8
  • Tom Clancy‚Äôs Rainbow Six Siege X
  • Teamfight Tactics
  • Trackmania
  • VALORANT

The newest additions to the lineup this year are Fortnite and Trackmania, both of which are highly anticipated titles with sizeable prize pools. That being said, the entire event boasts a staggering pool, the largest pool in esports history.

While the Esports World Cup Foundation is yet to confirm the full EWC 2026 schedule, just knowing what‚Äôs on the horizon is enough for fans of the event to start getting excited. This is easily the grandest event in the entire esports space.

Will you be watching the Esports World Cup 2026? Let us know what game you‚Äôre most excited to see on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the new roadmap for Year 6 of the Apex Legends Global Series

item.title: Tarkov Dev‚Äôs New Game Could Be Revealed on February 1st
item.content:encoded:
Over the last couple of weeks, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games, Nikita Buyanov, busied himself posting cryptic images and brain teasers on social media. Eventually, an entirely new website surfaced, seemingly hosting some minigame teasing a new project called COR3.

Now, another website has surfaced, this one hosting nothing more than a countdown and a blurry video that, when examined, represents a first-person shooter that scales back to show an entire planet. That countdown expires on February 1st, which is when everyone believes we‚Äôll get something tangible about this game.

What is COR3, and Why is it Exciting?

Nikita Buyanov is one of the creative minds who has directed the growth of Escape from Tarkov over the last decade. He has dedicated his life to the extraction shooter, a fact that he pointed out when we interviewed him as part of a recent episode of Access Granted.

He recently took a cryptic turn on social media, posting stacks of enigmatic images and puzzles, which his followers set to decoding.

Before long, a website had been found, an interactive thing that placed users in some kind of post-apocalyptic bunker with a retro-futuristic computer system bursting with lore, teasers, and world-building elements. As it stands, we have little idea what COR3 is, but the best guess is that it‚Äôs Buyanov‚Äôs new project.

We say ‚ÄòBuyanov‚Äô and not Battlestate Games, as right now, there‚Äôs no indication that Battlestate is linked to COR3. The COR3 trademark, dug up by eagle-eyed netizens, is in Nikita‚Äôs name, and nobody but the man himself has been sharing content related to COR3 online.

On the countdown website, a clock is running out, and it‚Äôs set to expire on February 1st at 3 PM GMT / 10 AM EST. Nobody knows what will happen when that countdown hits zero, but it‚Äôs a safe bet that something more tangible will be revealed by Buyanov, and whoever else he‚Äôs working with (if anyone).

COR3 appears to represent some kind of alternate reality title set in a universe where Earth suffered from a catastrophic event. There‚Äôs talk of interplanetary travel, space pirates, and ships adrift in the great beyond, all of which couldn‚Äôt be further from Escape from Tarkov, the leading extraction shooter.

It‚Äôs set hundreds of years in the future, but the COR3 website that users could interact with boasted grounded elements like modern-day armor items and traditional computers.

What do you think Nikita‚Äôs new game is? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the tease for Stellar Blade 2‚Äôs location

item.title: Destiny 2 Shadow and Order Has Reportedly Been Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Destiny 2‚Äôs next major update has reportedly been delayed due to the forthcoming release of Marathon, Bungie‚Äôs new extraction shooter, in early March.

Destiny 2: Shadow & Order was originally slated for a March 3 release. However, after Bungie officially announced Marathon‚Äôs release date on Monday, Forbes‚Äô Paul Tussi reported that the next free Destiny update has been postponed. There‚Äôs no tentative release window for the content at the moment.

Shadow & Order is slated to be the final major update of the Year of Prophecy season of the game, which started back with the Rite of the Nine in-game event that occurred in May 2025.

While it‚Äôs full steam ahead on the marketing push for Marathon, pre-ordering Bungie‚Äôs new game scores Destiny players new cosmetics, Sparrows, and Ships. There are also new shaders, emotes, and more in celebration of the upcoming release.

In addition, the marathon marketing push includes a new limited edition PlayStation DualSense and Pulse Elite wireless headset. Learn more about the latest items here.

Are you eager for the next chapter of Destiny 2 to unfold? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Ball X Pit‚Äôs First Free Major Update Launches January 26

The first of three major updates for Ball x Pit has been revealed, as the Regal Update will be on its way to the game very soon.

SCOOP: The Island Returns In WWE 2K26 With A New Story

Insider Gaming has learned first details surrounding The Island in WWE 2K26 as the mode returns for a second year.

Limited Edition Marathon DualSense Controller and Headset Coming

Bungie and PlayStation have unveiled a limited edition Marathon-themed DualSense controller and Pulse Elite headset.

Stellar Blade 2 Location Tease Points To Post-Apocalyptic China

In a post on social media, the team at Shift Up have suggested that Stellar Blade 2 will be inspired by post-apocalyptic China.

item.title: Ball X Pit‚Äôs First Free Major Update Launches January 26
item.content:encoded:
Ball x Pit‚Äôs first major update, The Regal Update, has officially been announced, and it‚Äôs set to launch on January 26, 2026. Better yet, the update will be completely free for all players to claim.

This marks the first of three major updates promised for the game, with the remaining two currently scheduled to arrive in April and July. But before those roll around, The Regal Update is bringing plenty of new content to dive into.

Ball X Pit‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Regal Update‚Äô Introduces Two New Characters

A trailer shared on the official Ball x Pit X account revealed the headline additions: two brand-new playable characters joining the roster.

  • The Carouser, a character whose returning balls orbit around him
  • The Falconer, who is flanked by her two trusted falcons that throw balls

That‚Äôs not all, though. The Regal Update will also introduce eight new balls, alongside several new passives to expand build variety. To top things off, the developers teased a mysterious ‚Äúnice surprise‚Äù that they‚Äôre refusing to reveal ahead of launch. If their confidence is anything to go by, you‚Äôll want to jump in on January 26 to see it for yourself.

Here‚Äôs the full trailer, which showcases the two new heroes in action.

What do you think of the new Ball x Pit update? Will you be checking it out? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming content, check out the return of the Island in WWE 2k26, as well as the official release date for Bungie‚Äôs Marathon.
